feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Project System for ETO project scenario
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I'm studying for a future implementation the ETO scenario for complex projects using project system. I've read many sap materials from community, help portal and so on but i have still some doubts about the process, specifically the end of the process. I will use the sap standard example of the assembly of a turbine.

I have understood the initial processes of activities scheduling, purchasing of external materials, internal production. Now my doubts are about the last step of the process, the final assembly of the product.

The example of the turbine states that: "In this process it is presumed that the turbine is assembled in the plant."    So I would expect that either:

  • The turbine gets producted by a production order in sap PP.
  • The turbine gets producted by a network activity with a negative requirement (if we do not have/want PP master data such as routing, BOM and so on)

Otherwise i would expect that we should do deliveries from project to the customer's site for the assemblies required by turbine, and having an activity for assembling them at customer site (without tracking the material quantity flow in the system).

None of these is mentioned here, and also in other sap materials I have never understood this last part of the ETO process. 

Am I missing something about how the system should track these last activities of the process? 

 

Any suggestions or clarifications is appreciated! Thank you for your time

entry.title: SAP Project System for ETO projects scenario
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I'm studying for a future implementation the sap ETO scenario using project systems. I've read many materials from sap help portal, community but i have still some doubts about the process, specifically the end of the process where the final assembly takes place. I will use the sap example of assembly of a turbine.

I've understood the initial processes of activities scheduling, purchasing of external material and production of internal materials, but i do not understand how the final assembly of the turbine happens.

The example states that "In this process it is presumed that the turbine is assembled in the plant.".  So I would expect one of the following options:

  • The turbine gets produced by sap PP production order and then deliver it
  • The turbine gets produced by a network activity with negative requirement (if we do not have/want PP master data such as BOM, routing) and then deliver it

Otherwise we could do deliveries from project to the customer's site for the assemblies required by the turbine and use an activity for assembling them (without tracking the material quantity flow in SAP for the turbine).

But none of these it is mentioned in the example.

So my main concern is about this last step of complex ETO projects: do we need to track the production, the flow and delivery of the finished product to sell in the system? or can we use networks just for collecting costs without having in the system the end product that the customer requires ?

Am i missing something or not understanding something of the process?

Any suggestions or clarifications are appreciated! Thank you for your time

entry.title: SAP Project System for ETO project scenario
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

i'm studying for a future implementation the sap ETO scenario using project system. I've read many material from sap help portal, community but i have still some doubts about the process, specifically the last part where the final assembly takes place. I will use the sap example of assembly of a turbine.

I've understood the initial processes of activities scheduling, purchasing external materials and production of internal materials, but i do not understand how the final assembly of the turbine is done.

The example states that "In this process it is presumed that the turbine is assembled in the plant".  So i would expect one of the following options:

  • The material is produced by a production order in PP and then deliver it to customer
  • The material is produced by a network activity with negative requirement (if we do not want/have PP master data such as BOM, routing) and the deliver it to customer

Otherwise, if the assembly happens outside of our plant, i would expect the deliveries from project to customer's site for the assemblies required by the turbine, and then an network activity for assembling them (without tracking in the system the material quantity flow of the turbine).

None of these is mentioned in the example.

My main concern is about this last part of ETO projects. Do we need to track the material we sell to the customer in the system ? or can we use network just to collect costs for the project without having the material quantity flow for the end product we are selling?

 

Am i missing something about this ETO process?

Any suggestions or clarifications are appreciated! Thank you for your time

entry.title: S/4+EWM - API call for planned Handling Units (HUs)
entry.content:
Hi everyone, I'm currently working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (2023) with SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and I'm trying to automate a delivery from production process using APIs only.

My goal is to create an Inbound Delivery and the corresponding planned Handlings Units. I'm following the documentation provided here: Operations for Handling Unit API

I've been trying for days to create a planned HU via API but it doesn't work. The only thing that worked were stock HUs üòê

Is there any way to create planned Handling Units for a given Product through an API? If yes, could someone please share an examples payload?

I‚Äôd really appreciate any tips or suggestions. Thanks a lot!
Bart

entry.title: Local Currency change impact on Group reporting
entry.content:
We are planning to change the functional currency from local currency to Group currency USD for some of the consolidation units in the ledger Company code settings for local reporting decided by the management.

We need to understand its implication on the Group reporting consolidation unit currency settings which is same as functional currency and the data is transferred from Universal Journal.

Since the data transferred from universal journal is so far in GBP and the data in group reporting is already updated as GBP if we change the currency to USD in GR CU, we would like to understand how the transaction data in group reporting presently in local currency GBP will be converted to USD and how the balances LC is carried forward.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

2) I set up Characteristic Group Z001 in KEVG4(Assign Characteristic Groups to Actual Cycles)

Thanks. Regards.

entry.title: How to do manual posting with Secondary Costs G/L Accounts type?
entry.content:

I want to do manual posting with Secondary Costs G/L Accounts type in Cost Center Accounting. But it 's impossible to post with Secondary Costs G/L Accounts type in Cost Center Accounting. 
If it is impossible please let me know how to post only to management accounting accounts, without involving financial accounting.

thanks. regards.

entry.title: Availability check in sales order not available after delivery is created
entry.content:
Hello Community, 

I have the following situation:

MaterialStock
A0
B5
C10
D0

 

We create a sales order with material A requesting 30 units but material A doesn't have stock. As it has material B and C as substitutes, sales order gets created like this: 

ItemMaterialOrder QuantityConfirmed Qty
10A3015
11B55
12C1010
13A150

 

Then customer is creating the delivery with lines 11 and 12 as they have confirmed quantities. Units of line 13 goes to backorder. Then customer received some stock for material D, they want to execute availability check so that sales order gets updated with a new line with the available material and quantities for backorder are reduced. 

However, once we create the delivery we are not able to execute item availability again. Line with the original requested material has schedule line category CN and the substitutes have schedule line category CP.

Could someone help us mentioning why availability check is not working after we create the delivery if the sales order allows partial deliveries and how can we make it work?

 

Thanks a lot.

entry.title: Possibility to Insert new column of Vendor Name and CNPJ of receiver in EDOC_COCKPIT for Brazil
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

I recently implemented DRC Inbound for the Brazilian market. I received some questions from users saying that columns are missing in T-code EDOC_COCKPIT, such as Supplier Name and Recipient Name, as well as the Recipient's CNPJ (Corporate Taxpayer ID). The question makes sense, since we had these columns in GRC.

I came here to ask if there is a solution for this situation or if anyone has customized EDOC_COCKPIT.

Thanks in advance

Best regards,

Daniel Tsuji

entry.title: Questions about SAP ECC on-premise to S/4HANA Private Cloud Conversion
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am preparing for a SAP ECC on-premise to S/4HANA Private Cloud conversion and have several questions regarding the process and access requirements:

 

- Does the SAP provider install and prepare the S/4HANA system with the correct version and HANA database?

- Can the customer run the Readiness Check on the ECC source system? Is it the same as for an on-premise conversion?

- What type of access is provided for the private cloud system (e.g., root, GUI, HANA DB)?

- How is the SUM (Software Update Manager) executed on the source ECC system, and how should I select the migration option (DMO with System Move / DMOVE2S4)?

- Is it necessary to download and upload files to the target system for DMO with System Move?

- Will I have root system access to directories like /usr/sap/<SID>/SUM?

- Are the standard HANA directories on the cloud target the same as on-premise (e.g., /hana/shared, /hana/data, /hana/log)?

- How do I launch SUM on the cloud OS target for content migration?

- Should I prepare a sandbox system, or is it handled directly on the production system in the private cloud?

- If there is any migration failure, is it possible to reset and retry safely?

- I would appreciate any guidance, best practices, or tips for planning this migration to S/4HANA Private Cloud.

- I've seen in serval SAP blogs that it's recommended to install an AAS on the private cloud, connect it to the source system, and then run SUM directly on that AAS.

 

Thank you in advance! 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Service SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit SAP S/4HANA Cloud, extended edition SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit

entry.title: Fixing IGS Connection Issues After SID Change in S/4HANA Migration
entry.content:
When migrating an SAP S/4HANA system and changing the System ID (SID), you might encounter issues with graphical charts in certain transactions. A common example is Transaction DB02, which shows database performance and space statistics.

After migration, executing DB02 may result in :  IGS not available (RC=1), Charts not available

Root Cause
The Internet Graphics Service (IGS) is responsible for rendering charts in SAP GUI. It communicates via an RFC destination named IGS_RFC_DEST. When the SID changes during migration, this RFC destination still points to the old SID, causing the connection to fail.

Symptoms

  • Charts in DB02 are missing.
  • RFC destination IGS_RFC_DEST fails the connection test.
  • Error message: IGS not available (RC=1).

Solution: Update RFC Destination
Step 1: Go to Transaction SM59

Navigate to RFC Destinations.
Search for IGS_RFC_DEST (Type: TCP/IP Connection).

Step 2: Test the Connection

Perform a Connection Test.
It will fail because the program name and gateway details are incorrect.

Step 3: Update the RFC Parameters
Modify the following fields:

  • Program Name: IGS.<SID> (Replace <SID> with your new system ID.)
  • Gateway Host: Set this to the CI (Central Instance) server host of the new SID.
  • Gateway Service: sapgw<nn> (Replace <nn> with the instance number of the CI.)

Step 4: Save and Test Again

Run the Connection Test. It should now succeed.

Step 5: Verify in DB02

Execute DB02 again. Charts should now be visible.

Additional Tips

  • After any SID change, review all RFC destinations in SM59.
  • Check other services like SAP Gateway and IGS to ensure they are running.
  • If you use load-balanced systems, verify the gateway host points to the correct application server.

entry.title: Missing ItemID/DocumentItemText in Confirmation Response of 'JournalEntryCreateRequestConfi'
entry.content:
Hi SAP member,

 

The standard API(JournalEntryCreateRequestConfi' for AR and AP postings) does not return the ItemID/DocumentItemText element in the Confirmation response in S4 HANA Private Cloud. As a result, users are unable to determine which Item ID an error message pertains to.
Is there a way to retrieve ItemID or DocumentItemText in the Confirmation response
 
Thanks.
Regards,
Sravan kumar Nendrambaka
